item.title: [PI] Help with making Teleports require runes [PI]
item.dc:creator: @TyPrizza TyPrizza
item.description:
@TyPrizza wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:8, topic:546310”][quote author=TyPrizza link=topic=665208.msg4446919#msg4446919 date=1409284466]

import ???
import ???
import ???

/*
 * Teleports
*/

	private boolean canTeleport() 
	{
			if(!doesntHaveRunes() 
		{
     			sendMessage("You need ruins.");
     			return false;
		}
		if(inBadArea()) {
     			sendMessage("You cannot teleport here.");
     			return false;
		}
			return true;
		}
	}



	public void clickTeleport(int buttonClicked, Client player) 
	{
		if(!validButton()) 
		{
			return;
		} 
		If(canTeleport()) 
		{
     			player.getPA().teleport(THE_POSITION_DATA_FROM_THE_ENUM);
     			player.sendMessage("You have Teleport.");
		}
	}



	enum TeleportData 
		{
			LUMBRIDGE(01, 10, new Item[] { new Item(563, 1), new Item(556, 5), new Item(557, 1) }, 
			new Position( Config.LUMBY_X, Config.LUMBY_Y, 1));
			private int buttonId, int levelReq;
			private Position teleTo;     
			private Item[] runesReq;
		}

/*
 * End of Teleports
*/

then what would i do with the ClickingButtons?

[/quote]
The class wouldn’t be structured that way, as it would give errors.

Like I said. I’m giving you an example. I’m not gonna spoonfeed you so you added all this and learned nothing. That’d be a waste of both our times.

[code=java]
package put.the.package.its.in.here;

//imports go here

public enum TeleportData {

 LUMBRIDGE(01, 10, new Item[] { new Item(563, 1), new Item(555, 5) }, new Position( 0000, 1111, 2));
 private int buttonId, int levelReq;
 private Position teleTo;
 private Item[] runesReq;

//Getters here…

//Handles when a player clicks a button HUGE HINT
public void clickTeleport(int buttonClicked, Client player) {
if(!validButton())// Just in case the buttonClicked id is NOT one in the enum…
return;
if(canTeleport()) {
player.getPA().teleport(THE_POSITION_DATA_FROM_THE_ENUM);
player.sendMessage(“Omg you teleported!”);
}

}

//Checks if the person can teleport. You might want to fix the !doesntHaveRunes() and !inBadArea()…
private boolean canTeleport() {
if(!doesntHaveRunes() {
sendMessage(“Yo get the runes”);
return false;
}
if(inBadArea()) {
sendMessage(“You cannot teleport here”);
return false;
}
return true;
}
//End of file.
}[/code][/quote]

Okay thank you, thats all i needed to know. I think i can handle the rest…

Read full topic

/*

[/quote]

[code=java]
package put.the.package.its.in.here;

//imports go here

public enum TeleportData {

 LUMBRIDGE(01, 10, new Item[] { new Item(563, 1), new Item(555, 5) }, new Position( 0000, 1111, 2));

if(!validButton())// Just in case the buttonClicked id is NOT one in the enum…
return;

player.getPA().teleport(THE_POSITION_DATA_FROM_THE_ENUM);
player.sendMessage(“Omg you teleported!”);
}

}

//Checks if the person can teleport. You might want to fix the !doesntHaveRunes() and !inBadArea()…
private boolean canTeleport() {
if(!doesntHaveRunes() {
sendMessage(“Yo get the runes”);
return false;
}
if(inBadArea()) {
sendMessage(“You cannot teleport here”);
return false;
}
return true;
}
//End of file.

item.title: [PI] Help with making Teleports require runes [PI]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“TyPrizza, post:5, topic:546310”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=665208.msg4446904#msg4446904 date=1409281476]
That would be because, as I said before, it is an example.
In no way, shape, or form will the current code run correctly.

It is to be used as “building blocks”. The code is a good start, you must then build off it for it to work.
[/quote]

mainly what im asking is, Do I Put It All In ClickingButtons?[/quote]
No.
You’d want to call the method in clicking buttons. This all could go into it’s own class…

item.source: [PI] Help with making Teleports require runes [PI]

item.title: [PI] Help with making Teleports require runes [PI]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

First, collect data for all the teleports. The data you’ll probably need:
Required level,
What runes, and how many,
X, Y, Z coords for each teleport.
Clicking button id for each teleport

The last one is bolded because it is important.

Now, the next part is up to you.
You need to figure out how you want to store this data.
I personally would use an enum.
Ex:

[code=java]

enum TeleportData {
LUMBRIDGE(01, 10, new Item[] { new Item(563, 1), new Item(555, 5) }, new Position( 0000, 1111, 2));
private int buttonId, int levelReq;
private Position teleTo;
private Item[] runesReq;
}[/code]

And then you’d make getters for the data appropriately.

Then you need to make a method to check if they have all the required items, along with it make sure they can teleport (like make sure if they aren’t in a duel, etc).
Hint: make it return a boolean

private boolean canTeleport() { if(!doesntHaveRunes() { sendMessage("Yo get the runes"); return false; } if(inBadArea()) { sendMessage("You cannot teleport here"); return false; } return true; }

Don’t forget to make the method handle the actual clicking…

[code=java]
public void clickTeleport(int buttonClicked, Client player) {
if(!validButton())// Just in case the buttonClicked id is NOT one in the enum…
return;
if(canTeleport()) {
player.getPA().teleport(THE_POSITION_DATA_FROM_THE_ENUM);
player.sendMessage(“Omg you teleported!”);
}

}[/code]

Bad example is bad but I hope this can help.

Read full topic
